elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Answer the following multiple-choice questions about customer meetings and briefly justify the solutions you have chosen. Several answers may be correct.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What goal should you generally pursue with a customer meeting?
choices: Convince the customer.
Intimidate the customer.
Get to know the customer better.
Confuse the customer.
correctAnswer: Get to know the customer better.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: The aim of customer meetings is to convince the customer of the service offered or to get to know him better in order to recommend a more suitable product.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following multiple-choice questions about customer meetings and briefly justify the solutions you have chosen. Several answers may be correct.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Why is it important to actively listen when talking to a customer?
choices: Not to contradict the customer.
To impose your own opinion.
To understand the customer's needs.
To interrupt the customer at a suitable point.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: The customer's needs should be better understood through proper listening.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the following multiple-choice questions about customer meetings and briefly justify the solutions you have chosen. Several answers may be correct.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: What role does empathy play in a successful customer meeting?
choices: Empathy must not have any influence, otherwise you are biased.
Empathy is important in order to understand the customer's needs.
Empathy is irrelevant, only the product counts.
Empathy is only important for social conversations.
correctAnswer: Empathy is important in order to understand the customer's needs.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: Empathy helps you to be fully attuned to the customer.

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: Answer the following multiple-choice questions about customer meetings and briefly justify the solutions you have chosen. Several answers may be correct.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: What is the best way to deal with a customer's objections?
choices: Ignore them and move on to the next point.
Convince the customer that their objections are unfounded.
Take the customer's objections seriously and offer solutions.
Criticize the customer for his objections.
correctAnswer: Take the customer's objections seriously and offer solutions.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: The customer's objections should definitely be discussed and solutions sought.

elements.name: panel4
elements.title: Answer the following multiple-choice questions about customer meetings and briefly justify the solutions you have chosen. Several answers may be correct.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: What is the difference between open and closed questions in a customer meeting?
choices: Open questions should be asked in discussions with customers.
Open questions require only yes/no answers, closed questions encourage detailed answers.
Open questions encourage detailed answers, closed questions only require yes/no answers.
Open questions are suitable for informal discussions, closed questions for formal discussions.
correctAnswer: Open questions should be asked in discussions with customers.
Open questions encourage detailed answers, closed questions only require yes/no answers.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: By answering open questions, the customer reveals a lot, which can help to better understand her needs.

elements.name: panel5
elements.title: Answer the following multiple-choice questions about customer meetings and briefly justify the solutions you have chosen. Several answers may be correct.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: How can you build trust in a customer meeting?
choices: By withholding important information.
By communicating honestly, transparently and reliably.
By criticizing the customer.
By being friendly and approachable.
correctAnswer: By communicating honestly, transparently and reliably.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: Give reasons for your answer.
elements.correctAnswer: Open, honest and friendly communication helps to build trust.
